first_reading.title: 1st book of Kings
first_reading.text:
[[1_R 17,1]]Elijah the Tishbite, from Tishbe in Gilead, said to Ahab: "As the LORD, the God of Israel, lives, whom I serve, during these years there shall be no dew or rain except at my word."
[[1_R 17,2]]The LORD then said to Elijah:
[[1_R 17,3]]"Leave here, go east and hide in the Wadi Cherith, east of the Jordan.
[[1_R 17,4]]You shall drink of the stream, and I have commanded ravens to feed you there."
[[1_R 17,5]]So he left and did as the LORD had commanded. He went and remained by the Wadi Cherith, east of the Jordan.
[[1_R 17,6]]Ravens brought him bread and meat in the morning, and bread and meat in the evening, and he drank from the stream.

gospel.title: Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ according to Saint Matthew
gospel.text:
[[Mt 5,1]]When Jesus saw the crowds, he went up the mountain, and after he had sat down, his disciples came to him.
[[Mt 5,2]]He began to teach them, saying:
[[Mt 5,3]]"Blessed are the poor in spirit, for theirs is the kingdom of heaven.
[[Mt 5,4]]Blessed are they who mourn, for they will be comforted.
[[Mt 5,5]]Blessed are the meek, for they will inherit the land.
[[Mt 5,6]]Blessed are they who hunger and thirst for righteousness, for they will be satisfied.
[[Mt 5,7]]Blessed are the merciful, for they will be shown mercy.
[[Mt 5,8]]Blessed are the clean of heart, for they will see God.
[[Mt 5,9]]Blessed are the peacemakers, for they will be called children of God.
[[Mt 5,10]]Blessed are they who are persecuted for the sake of righteousness, for theirs is the kingdom of heaven.
[[Mt 5,11]]Blessed are you when they insult you and persecute you and utter every kind of evil against you (falsely) because of me.
[[Mt 5,12]]Rejoice and be glad, for your reward will be great in heaven."

psalm.text:
[[Ps 121,1]]I lift up my eyes toward the mountains;
whence shall help come to me?
[[Ps 121,2]]My help is from the LORD,
who made heaven and earth.

[[Ps 121,3]]May he not suffer your foot to slip;
may he slumber not who guards you:
[[Ps 121,4]]indeed he neither slumbers nor sleeps,
the guardian of Israel.

[[Ps 121,5]]The LORD is your guardian; the LORD is your shade;
he is beside you at your right hand.
[[Ps 121,6]]The sun shall not harm you by day,
nor the moon by night.

[[Ps 121,7]]The LORD will guard you from all evil;
he will guard your life.
[[Ps 121,8]]The LORD will guard your coming and your going,
both now and forever.
